Instruction:
Step 1: Remove chicken breasts from refrigerator and let sit at room temperature for 15 minutes. Pat dry with paper towels and season generously with salt, pepper, and paprika on both sides.
Step 2: Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat until shimmering.
Step 3: Add 4-5 minced garlic cloves to the pan and sauté for 30-45 seconds until fragrant, being careful not to burn.
Step 4: Add chicken breasts to the pan, laying them away from you to avoid splatter. Cook for 6-7 minutes without moving.
Step 5: Flip chicken and cook for another 6-7 minutes until golden brown and internal temperature reaches 165°F.
Step 6: Remove chicken from pan and let rest for 5 minutes before slicing.
Step 7: In the same pan, add remaining garlic and a splash of chicken stock to create a pan sauce.
Step 8: Pour sauce over sliced chicken and garnish with fresh parsley. Serve hot.

Step 1: Bring a large pot of salted water to a rolling boil (use 1 tablespoon salt per quart of water).
Step 2: Add pasta and cook according to package instructions until al dente, stirring occasionally.
Step 3: While pasta cooks, heat 3 tablespoons olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat.
Step 4: Add 4 minced garlic cloves and sauté for 1 minute until fragrant.
Step 5: Add 28 oz crushed tomatoes, stirring to combine.
Step 6: Season with 1 teaspoon salt, 1/2 teaspoon black pepper, and a pinch of red pepper flakes.
Step 7: Simmer sauce for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Step 8: Tear fresh basil leaves and stir into sauce in the last 2 minutes of cooking.
Step 9: Drain pasta, reserving 1 cup pasta water.
Step 10: Toss pasta with sauce, adding pasta water as needed for consistency.
Step 11: Serve immediately with grated Parmesan cheese.

Step 1: Wash and prepare all vegetables: slice bell peppers into strips, slice zucchini into half-moons, and quarter mushrooms.
Step 2: Prepare sauce by mixing 2 tablespoons soy sauce, 1 tablespoon rice vinegar, 1 teaspoon sesame oil, and 1 teaspoon cornstarch.
Step 3: Heat wok or large skillet over high heat until smoking.
Step 4: Add 2 tablespoons oil and swirl to coat the pan.
Step 5: Add minced garlic and ginger, stir-fry for 15-30 seconds.
Step 6: Add bell peppers first and stir-fry for 2 minutes.
Step 7: Add zucchini and cook for 2 minutes more.
Step 8: Add mushrooms and cook for another 2-3 minutes until all vegetables are tender-crisp.
Step 9: Pour sauce over vegetables and toss for 1 minute until thickened.
Step 10: Remove from heat and serve immediately over rice if desired.

Step 1: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Step 2: Pat salmon fillets dry with paper towels and place skin-side down on prepared baking sheet.
Step 3: Drizzle each fillet with 1 tablespoon olive oil and rub to coat evenly.
Step 4: Squeeze fresh lemon juice over each fillet (about 1 tablespoon per fillet).
Step 5: Season generously with salt, black pepper, and a pinch of garlic powder.
Step 6: Top each fillet with thin lemon slices and fresh thyme sprigs.
Step 7: Bake for 25-30 minutes until salmon flakes easily with a fork and internal temperature reaches 145°F.
Step 8: Remove from oven and let rest for 3 minutes.
Step 9: Garnish with fresh dill and additional lemon wedges before serving.

Step 1: Rinse 1 cup rice under cold water until water runs clear.
Step 2: Cook rice according to package instructions, adding a pinch of salt to the water.
Step 3: While rice cooks, slice beef into thin strips against the grain.
Step 4: Season beef with salt, pepper, and 1 teaspoon soy sauce.
Step 5: Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a large skillet over high heat.
Step 6: Add beef in a single layer and sear for 2-3 minutes without stirring.
Step 7: Flip beef and cook for another 2 minutes until browned but still slightly pink inside.
Step 8: Remove beef from pan and set aside.
Step 9: In the same pan, add minced garlic and sauté for 30 seconds.
Step 10: Fluff cooked rice with a fork and divide into bowls.
Step 11: Top rice with beef slices and drizzle with any pan juices.
Step 12: Garnish with sliced green onions and sesame seeds. Serve warm.

Step 1: Drain and rinse 2 cans of chickpeas, patting them dry.
Step 2: Heat 2 tablespoons coconut oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Step 3: Add 2 tablespoons curry powder and toast for 30-45 seconds until fragrant.
Step 4: Add 1 diced onion and cook for 4-5 minutes until softened.
Step 5: Add 3 minced garlic cloves and 1 tablespoon grated ginger, cook for 1 minute.
Step 6: Stir in chickpeas and coat with curry mixture.
Step 7: Pour in 1 can (14 oz) coconut milk and 1/2 cup vegetable stock.
Step 8: Add 1 teaspoon salt, 1/2 teaspoon cumin, and a pinch of cayenne pepper.
Step 9: Bring to a simmer and cook for 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Step 10: Taste and adjust seasoning as needed.
Step 11: Stir in fresh cilantro and a squeeze of lime juice.
Step 12: Serve hot over basmati rice or with naan bread.

Step 1: Crack 3 eggs into a bowl and whisk with 1 tablespoon milk, salt, and pepper.
Step 2: Dice bell pepper and onion into small pieces.
Step 3: Heat 1 tablespoon butter in a non-stick skillet over medium heat.
Step 4: Add diced vegetables and sauté for 3-4 minutes until softened.
Step 5: Push vegetables to one side of the pan.
Step 6: Pour whisked eggs into the empty side of the pan.
Step 7: Let eggs set for 30 seconds, then gently push from edges toward center with a spatula.
Step 8: When eggs are mostly set but still slightly runny on top, fold omelette in half.
Step 9: Cook for another 30-60 seconds.
Step 10: Slide onto a plate and serve immediately with toast.

Step 1: Rinse 1 cup quinoa thoroughly under cold water using a fine-mesh strainer.
Step 2: Combine quinoa with 2 cups water in a medium saucepan and add a pinch of salt.
Step 3: Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and cover.
Step 4: Simmer for 15 minutes until water is absorbed.
Step 5: Remove from heat and let stand covered for 5 minutes.
Step 6: Fluff quinoa with a fork and spread on a plate to cool.
Step 7: While quinoa cools, dice tomatoes, cucumber, and red onion.
Step 8: Chop lettuce or mixed greens.
Step 9: Transfer cooled quinoa to a large bowl.
Step 10: Add diced vegetables and greens to the bowl.
Step 11: Whisk together 3 tablespoons olive oil, 2 tablespoons lemon juice, salt, and pepper for dressing.
Step 12: Pour dressing over salad and toss well to combine.
Step 13: Let sit for 10 minutes for flavors to meld before serving.

Step 1: Toast 2 slices of whole grain bread until golden brown and crispy.
Step 2: While bread toasts, cut 1 ripe avocado in half and remove pit.
Step 3: Scoop avocado flesh into a small bowl.
Step 4: Add juice of half a lemon, a pinch of salt, and black pepper.
Step 5: Mash avocado with a fork until desired consistency (leave some chunks for texture).
Step 6: Optionally add red pepper flakes or everything bagel seasoning.
Step 7: Spread mashed avocado generously on toasted bread.
Step 8: Top with optional additions like sliced cherry tomatoes, radishes, or a fried egg.
Step 9: Drizzle with a little olive oil.
Step 10: Serve immediately while toast is still warm.

Step 1: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Step 2: Cook 1 cup rice according to package instructions with vegetable stock for extra flavor.
Step 3: While rice cooks, prepare 4 large bell peppers by cutting off the tops and removing all seeds and membranes.
Step 4: Lightly brush peppers with olive oil, inside and out.
Step 5: Place peppers upright in a baking dish.
Step 6: In a large bowl, combine cooked rice with sautéed onions, diced tomatoes, and seasonings.
Step 7: Add fresh herbs like basil and oregano to the rice mixture.
Step 8: Stuff each pepper generously with the rice mixture, packing it down gently.
Step 9: Top each pepper with a little shredded cheese if desired.
Step 10: Pour 1/4 cup water into the bottom of the baking dish.
Step 11: Cover dish with foil and bake for 35 minutes.
Step 12: Remove foil and bake for another 10 minutes until peppers are tender and tops are golden.
Step 13: Let cool for 5 minutes before serving.

Step 1: Wash and dry 3 medium zucchini.
Step 2: Using a spiralizer or julienne peeler, create zucchini noodles.
Step 3: Place zucchini noodles in a colander and sprinkle lightly with salt.
Step 4: Let sit for 10 minutes to release excess moisture, then pat dry with paper towels.
Step 5: Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large pan over medium heat.
Step 6: Add 3-4 minced garlic cloves and sauté for 30 seconds.
Step 7: Add zucchini noodles and toss gently for 2-3 minutes until just tender.
Step 8: Don't overcook or noodles will become mushy.
Step 9: Season with salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes.
Step 10: Remove from heat and toss with fresh basil and a squeeze of lemon.
Step 11: Serve immediately as a side dish or topped with your favorite sauce.

Step 1: Slice 1 lb beef into thin strips.
Step 2: Season beef with salt, pepper, and garlic powder.
Step 3: Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a large cast-iron skillet over high heat.
Step 4: Add beef in a single layer and sear for 2-3 minutes until browned.
Step 5: Flip beef and cook for another 2 minutes.
Step 6: Remove beef from skillet and set aside.
Step 7: In the same skillet, add sliced mushrooms, bell peppers, and zucchini.
Step 8: Sauté vegetables for 5-6 minutes until tender but still crisp.
Step 9: Season vegetables with salt and pepper.
Step 10: Return beef to the skillet and toss everything together.
Step 11: Add 1 tablespoon butter and let it melt over the beef and vegetables.
Step 12: Cook for 1-2 more minutes until everything is heated through.
Step 13: Garnish with fresh parsley and serve hot.

Step 1: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Step 2: Peel and cube 2 large sweet potatoes into 1-inch pieces.
Step 3: Toss sweet potato cubes with 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large bowl.
Step 4: Season with salt, pepper, paprika, and a pinch of cinnamon.
Step 5: Spread sweet potatoes in a single layer on the baking sheet.
Step 6: Roast for 25-30 minutes, flipping halfway through, until tender and caramelized.
Step 7: While sweet potatoes roast, cook 1/2 cup quinoa according to package directions.
Step 8: Prepare any additional toppings like chickpeas, avocado, or tahini dressing.
Step 9: Divide quinoa into serving bowls.
Step 10: Top with roasted sweet potatoes and desired toppings.
Step 11: Drizzle with tahini dressing or olive oil.
Step 12: Garnish with fresh cilantro or parsley and serve warm.

Step 1: Clean and slice 8 oz mushrooms (cremini or button mushrooms work well).
Step 2: In a large saucepan, heat 2 tablespoons butter over medium heat.
Step 3: Add mushrooms and cook for 5-7 minutes until golden and liquid has evaporated.
Step 4: Add 1 diced onion and 2 minced garlic cloves, cook for 3 minutes.
Step 5: Stir in 1.5 cups Arborio rice and toast for 2 minutes, stirring constantly.
Step 6: Pour in 1/2 cup white wine and stir until absorbed.
Step 7: Add 4 cups warm chicken or vegetable stock, one ladle at a time.
Step 8: Stir constantly and wait for each addition to be absorbed before adding more stock.
Step 9: This process takes about 20-25 minutes.
Step 10: Rice should be creamy but still have a slight bite (al dente).
Step 11: Remove from heat and stir in 2 tablespoons butter and 1/2 cup grated Parmesan.
Step 12: Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Step 13: Let rest for 2 minutes, then serve immediately garnished with fresh parsley.

Step 1: Start with 1 cup plain Greek yogurt in a serving bowl or glass.
Step 2: Wash and prepare fresh fruit: slice strawberries, measure blueberries, and dice any other desired fruits.
Step 3: Layer half the yogurt in the bottom of the bowl.
Step 4: Add a layer of mixed berries.
Step 5: Drizzle with 1 tablespoon honey or maple syrup.
Step 6: Add the remaining yogurt on top.
Step 7: Top with more fresh fruit.
Step 8: Sprinkle with 1/4 cup granola.
Step 9: Add a few sliced almonds or other nuts for crunch.
Step 10: Drizzle with an additional teaspoon of honey if desired.
Step 11: Serve immediately while granola is still crunchy.

Step 1: Season 2 chicken breasts with salt and pepper.
Step 2: Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a pan over medium heat.
Step 3: Cook chicken for 6-7 minutes per side until fully cooked (internal temp 165°F).
Step 4: Remove from heat and let rest for 5 minutes.
Step 5: Dice the cooked chicken into bite-sized pieces.
Step 6: Wash and chop lettuce, romaine, or mixed greens.
Step 7: Dice cucumber, cherry tomatoes, and red onion.
Step 8: In a large bowl, combine greens and diced vegetables.
Step 9: Add diced chicken on top.
Step 10: Prepare dressing by whisking together olive oil, lemon juice, Dijon mustard, salt, and pepper.
Step 11: Pour dressing over salad and toss well.
Step 12: Top with optional additions like croutons, nuts, or cheese.
Step 13: Serve immediately while chicken is still warm.

Step 1: Drain and rinse 1 can (15 oz) black beans.
Step 2: Heat beans in a small pot over medium heat with cumin and chili powder.
Step 3: Mash about half the beans with a fork for creamier texture.
Step 4: Warm corn or flour tortillas in a dry skillet for 30 seconds per side.
Step 5: Keep tortillas warm wrapped in a clean kitchen towel.
Step 6: Dice tomatoes, lettuce, and red onion for toppings.
Step 7: Prepare any desired toppings: guacamole, salsa, sour cream, cheese.
Step 8: Spread warm black beans down the center of each tortilla.
Step 9: Top with diced vegetables.
Step 10: Add your choice of toppings.
Step 11: Garnish with fresh cilantro and a squeeze of lime.
Step 12: Serve immediately with lime wedges on the side.

Step 1: Remove steak from refrigerator 30 minutes before cooking to bring to room temperature.
Step 2: Pat steak dry with paper towels.
Step 3: Season generously on both sides with salt and black pepper.
Step 4: Preheat grill or cast-iron skillet over high heat.
Step 5: Brush steak lightly with olive oil.
Step 6: Place steak on hot grill or pan and don't move it for 4-5 minutes.
Step 7: Flip once and cook for another 4-5 minutes for medium-rare (adjust time for desired doneness).
Step 8: Remove steak and let rest for 5-10 minutes before slicing.
Step 9: While steak rests, prepare vegetables: cut zucchini and bell peppers into chunks.
Step 10: Toss vegetables with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Step 11: Roast vegetables at 425°F for 20-25 minutes until tender and caramelized.
Step 12: Slice steak against the grain.
Step 13: Serve sliced steak with roasted vegetables on the side.

Step 1: Wash fresh spinach thoroughly and pat dry.
Step 2: Crack 3 eggs into a bowl.
Step 3: Add 1 tablespoon milk, salt, and pepper to eggs.
Step 4: Whisk eggs vigorously until well combined and slightly frothy.
Step 5: Heat 1 tablespoon butter in a non-stick skillet over medium heat.
Step 6: Add spinach to the pan and cook for 1-2 minutes until wilted.
Step 7: Season spinach lightly with salt.
Step 8: Pour whisked eggs over the spinach.
Step 9: Let eggs sit undisturbed for 30 seconds to start setting.
Step 10: Using a spatula, gently push eggs from edges to center, allowing uncooked egg to flow underneath.
Step 11: Continue this process until eggs are mostly cooked but still slightly wet.
Step 12: Remove from heat (residual heat will finish cooking).
Step 13: Serve immediately with whole grain toast.

Step 1: Rinse 1 cup jasmine or basmati rice under cold water until water runs clear.
Step 2: In a medium pot, combine rice with 1 can (14 oz) coconut milk and 1/2 cup water.
Step 3: Add 1/2 teaspoon salt and stir to combine.
Step 4: Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally.
Step 5: Once boiling, reduce heat to low and cover with a tight-fitting lid.
Step 6: Simmer for 15 minutes without lifting the lid.
Step 7: After 15 minutes, remove from heat and let stand covered for 5 more minutes.
Step 8: Fluff rice gently with a fork.
Step 9: Taste and adjust salt if needed.
Step 10: Garnish with toasted coconut flakes if desired.
Step 11: Serve warm as a side dish or base for curry.

Step 1: Roughly chop 2 lbs fresh tomatoes (or use 28 oz canned whole tomatoes).
Step 2: Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Step 3: Add 1 diced onion and cook for 5 minutes until softened.
Step 4: Add 4 minced garlic cloves and sauté for 1 minute.
Step 5: Add chopped tomatoes and stir to combine.
Step 6: Season with salt, pepper, and a pinch of sugar to balance acidity.
Step 7: Add 2 cups vegetable stock.
Step 8: Bring to a simmer and cook for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Step 9: Stir in 1/4 cup fresh basil leaves.
Step 10: Remove from heat and let cool slightly.
Step 11: Use an immersion blender to puree soup until smooth (or transfer to a blender in batches).
Step 12: Return to pot and stir in 1/4 cup heavy cream for richness.
Step 13: Taste and adjust seasoning.
Step 14: Serve hot garnished with fresh basil and a drizzle of olive oil.

Step 1: Season 2 salmon fillets with salt, pepper, and a drizzle of olive oil.
Step 2: Preheat grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
Step 3: Brush grill grates with oil to prevent sticking.
Step 4: Place salmon skin-side down on the grill.
Step 5: Cook for 4-5 minutes without moving.
Step 6: Carefully flip salmon and cook for another 4-5 minutes until cooked through.
Step 7: While salmon grills, cook 1/2 cup quinoa according to package directions.
Step 8: Prepare vegetables: dice cucumber, cherry tomatoes, and red onion.
Step 9: Make a simple dressing with lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Step 10: Fluff cooked quinoa and divide into serving bowls.
Step 11: Top quinoa with diced vegetables.
Step 12: Place grilled salmon on top of each bowl.
Step 13: Drizzle with dressing and garnish with fresh dill.
Step 14: Serve immediately with lemon wedges.

Step 1: Cook 8 oz rice noodles according to package instructions, drain and rinse with cold water.
Step 2: In a small bowl, whisk together 1/4 cup peanut butter, 2 tablespoons soy sauce, 1 tablespoon rice vinegar, 1 tablespoon honey, and 1 teaspoon sesame oil.
Step 3: Add 2-3 tablespoons warm water to thin sauce to desired consistency.
Step 4: Stir in 1 teaspoon minced ginger and 1 minced garlic clove.
Step 5: Add a pinch of red pepper flakes for heat.
Step 6: Julienne bell peppers, carrots, and cucumber.
Step 7: Toss cooked noodles with peanut sauce in a large bowl.
Step 8: Add julienned vegetables and toss to combine.
Step 9: Let sit for 5 minutes for flavors to meld.
Step 10: Garnish with chopped peanuts, fresh cilantro, and lime wedges.
Step 11: Serve at room temperature or chilled.

Step 1: Rinse 1 cup quinoa and cook according to package directions with vegetable broth.
Step 2: Let cooked quinoa cool to room temperature.
Step 3: Dice cucumber, cherry tomatoes, and red onion.
Step 4: Crumble 1/2 cup feta cheese.
Step 5: Slice Kalamata olives.
Step 6: In a large bowl, combine cooled quinoa with all diced vegetables.
Step 7: Add feta cheese and olives.
Step 8: Make dressing: whisk together 3 tablespoons olive oil, 2 tablespoons lemon juice, 1 teaspoon Dijon mustard, and oregano.
Step 9: Season dressing with salt and pepper.
Step 10: Pour dressing over quinoa mixture and toss well.
Step 11: Let salad sit for 10 minutes before serving.
Step 12: Garnish with fresh parsley and additional feta.
Step 13: Serve at room temperature or chilled.

Step 1: Cut 2 lbs beef chuck into 1.5-inch cubes.
Step 2: Season beef generously with salt and pepper.
Step 3: Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a large Dutch oven over high heat.
Step 4: Brown beef in batches, about 3-4 minutes per side, don't overcrowd the pot.
Step 5: Remove browned beef and set aside.
Step 6: In the same pot, add diced onions and cook for 5 minutes.
Step 7: Add minced garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Step 8: Stir in 2 tablespoons tomato paste and cook for 1 minute.
Step 9: Pour in 1 cup red wine to deglaze, scraping up browned bits from bottom.
Step 10: Add beef back to pot along with 4 cups beef stock.
Step 11: Add bay leaves, thyme, and rosemary.
Step 12: Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and cover.
Step 13: Simmer for 1.5 hours.
Step 14: Add chopped carrots, celery, and potatoes.
Step 15: Continue simmering for another 30-45 minutes until beef is tender and vegetables are cooked.
Step 16: Remove bay leaves, adjust seasoning, and serve hot with crusty bread.

Step 1: Peel and devein 1 lb large shrimp, pat dry with paper towels.
Step 2: Cook 8 oz pasta according to package directions, reserve 1 cup pasta water.
Step 3: In a large skillet, melt 3 tablespoons butter over medium heat.
Step 4: Add 5 minced garlic cloves and red pepper flakes, cook for 1 minute.
Step 5: Add shrimp in a single layer and cook for 2 minutes per side until pink.
Step 6: Remove shrimp and set aside.
Step 7: Add 1/2 cup white wine to the pan and let reduce by half.
Step 8: Add juice of 1 lemon and 1/4 cup pasta water.
Step 9: Return shrimp to pan along with drained pasta.
Step 10: Toss everything together for 1-2 minutes.
Step 11: Stir in 2 tablespoons butter and season with salt and pepper.
Step 12: Remove from heat and toss with fresh parsley.
Step 13: Serve immediately with grated Parmesan and lemon wedges.

Step 1: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Step 2: Cut 1 large head of cauliflower into florets.
Step 3: Pulse cauliflower in a food processor until rice-like texture.
Step 4: Steam cauliflower rice for 5 minutes, then squeeze out excess moisture using a clean kitchen towel.
Step 5: In a bowl, mix cauliflower rice with 1 egg, 1 cup shredded mozzarella, 1/4 cup Parmesan, and Italian seasoning.
Step 6: Form mixture into a pizza crust shape on a parchment-lined baking sheet.
Step 7: Bake for 20 minutes until golden.
Step 8: Remove from oven and add pizza sauce, spreading evenly.
Step 9: Top with mozzarella cheese and your favorite toppings.
Step 10: Return to oven and bake for 15 more minutes until cheese is melted and bubbly.
Step 11: Let cool for 5 minutes before slicing.
Step 12: Garnish with fresh basil and serve.

Step 1: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Step 2: Pat 1.5 lb pork tenderloin dry and season with salt and pepper.
Step 3: Heat 2 tablespoons oil in an oven-safe skillet over high heat.
Step 4: Sear pork on all sides until golden brown, about 2-3 minutes per side.
Step 5: In a small bowl, whisk together 1/4 cup honey, 2 tablespoons Dijon mustard, 2 tablespoons soy sauce, and 2 minced garlic cloves.
Step 6: Brush half of the glaze over the seared pork.
Step 7: Transfer skillet to oven and roast for 15-20 minutes.
Step 8: Brush with remaining glaze halfway through cooking.
Step 9: Cook until internal temperature reaches 145°F.
Step 10: Remove from oven and let rest for 10 minutes before slicing.
Step 11: Slice pork into medallions.
Step 12: Drizzle with any remaining glaze from the pan and serve.

Step 1: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Step 2: Slice 2 large eggplants into 1/2-inch rounds.
Step 3: Salt eggplant slices and let sit for 30 minutes to draw out moisture.
Step 4: Pat slices dry with paper towels.
Step 5: Set up breading station: flour in one dish, beaten eggs in another, breadcrumbs mixed with Parmesan in a third.
Step 6: Dredge each eggplant slice in flour, then egg, then breadcrumb mixture.
Step 7: Heat 1/4 inch oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Step 8: Fry eggplant slices for 2-3 minutes per side until golden.
Step 9: Drain on paper towels.
Step 10: Spread 1 cup marinara sauce in the bottom of a baking dish.
Step 11: Layer fried eggplant slices, overlapping slightly.
Step 12: Top with more marinara and shredded mozzarella.
Step 13: Repeat layers ending with cheese.
Step 14: Bake for 30-35 minutes until bubbly and golden.
Step 15: Let rest for 10 minutes before serving.
Step 16: Garnish with fresh basil.

Step 1: In a bowl, mix 1 lb ground chicken with 2 tablespoons soy sauce, 1 tablespoon grated ginger, and 2 minced garlic cloves.
Step 2: Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Step 3: Add chicken mixture and cook for 8-10 minutes, breaking up with a spoon, until fully cooked.
Step 4: Add diced water chestnuts for crunch.
Step 5: Stir in 2 tablespoons hoisin sauce and 1 tablespoon rice vinegar.
Step 6: Add sliced green onions and cook for 1 more minute.
Step 7: Remove from heat.
Step 8: Separate leaves from 1 head of butter lettuce, washing and drying them carefully.
Step 9: Arrange lettuce cups on a serving platter.
Step 10: Spoon chicken mixture into each lettuce cup.
Step 11: Top with shredded carrots, cilantro, and crushed peanuts.
Step 12: Serve with lime wedges and extra hoisin sauce on the side.

Step 1: Remove stems from 1 large bunch of kale and tear leaves into bite-sized pieces.
Step 2: Wash and thoroughly dry kale leaves.
Step 3: Place kale in a large bowl and massage with 1 tablespoon olive oil for 2-3 minutes to soften.
Step 4: Make Caesar dressing: blend 1/4 cup mayonnaise, 2 tablespoons lemon juice, 2 minced garlic cloves, 2 tablespoons Parmesan, 1 teaspoon Dijon mustard, and anchovies if desired.
Step 5: Add water to thin dressing if needed.
Step 6: Season dressing with salt and pepper.
Step 7: Pour dressing over massaged kale and toss well.
Step 8: Let salad sit for 10 minutes for kale to soften further.
Step 9: Make croutons: cube bread and toss with olive oil, salt, and garlic powder.
Step 10: Bake croutons at 375°F for 10-12 minutes until crispy.
Step 11: Top salad with croutons and shaved Parmesan.
Step 12: Serve immediately.

Step 1: Peel and devein 1 lb large shrimp.
Step 2: Pat shrimp dry and season with salt and paprika.
Step 3: In a bowl, whisk together 1 can coconut milk, 2 tablespoons curry powder, 1 tablespoon grated ginger, and 2 minced garlic cloves.
Step 4: Heat 1 tablespoon coconut oil in a large pan over medium heat.
Step 5: Add curry paste and toast for 30 seconds.
Step 6: Pour in coconut milk mixture and bring to a simmer.
Step 7: Add shrimp to the sauce.
Step 8: Cook for 5-6 minutes until shrimp are pink and cooked through.
Step 9: Stir in juice of 1 lime.
Step 10: Add fresh cilantro and sliced Thai basil.
Step 11: Adjust seasoning with salt and a pinch of sugar if needed.
Step 12: Serve over jasmine rice with lime wedges.

Step 1: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Step 2: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Step 3: Pat 4 cod fillets dry with paper towels.
Step 4: Place fillets on prepared baking sheet.
Step 5: Drizzle each fillet with olive oil.
Step 6: Season with salt, pepper, and garlic powder.
Step 7: Top each fillet with thin lemon slices.
Step 8: Sprinkle with fresh thyme and parsley.
Step 9: Bake for 12-15 minutes until fish flakes easily with a fork.
Step 10: While fish bakes, make herb butter: mix softened butter with minced garlic, lemon zest, and chopped fresh herbs.
Step 11: Remove fish from oven.
Step 12: Top each fillet with a pat of herb butter.
Step 13: Serve immediately with roasted vegetables or rice.

Step 1: Warm large flour tortillas in a dry skillet for 30 seconds per side.
Step 2: Crack 4 eggs into a bowl and whisk with 2 tablespoons milk.
Step 3: Season eggs with salt and pepper.
Step 4: Heat 1 tablespoon butter in a non-stick pan over medium heat.
Step 5: Pour in eggs and scramble gently until just set.
Step 6: Dice bell peppers and onions.
Step 7: Sauté vegetables in a separate pan for 3-4 minutes.
Step 8: Warm refried beans in a small pot.
Step 9: Lay out tortillas on a clean surface.
Step 10: Spread a layer of beans down the center of each tortilla.
Step 11: Top with scrambled eggs and sautéed vegetables.
Step 12: Add shredded cheddar cheese.
Step 13: Fold in sides and roll up tightly.
Step 14: Optional: grill seam-side down for 1-2 minutes to seal.
Step 15: Serve with salsa, sour cream, and avocado.

Step 1: Cut 1.5 lbs chicken breast into bite-sized pieces.
Step 2: Season chicken with salt and pepper.
Step 3: Make teriyaki sauce: whisk together 1/4 cup soy sauce, 2 tablespoons honey, 1 tablespoon rice vinegar, 1 teaspoon sesame oil, 1 minced garlic clove, and 1 teaspoon grated ginger.
Step 4: Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large skillet or wok over high heat.
Step 5: Add chicken and cook for 5-6 minutes until golden and cooked through.
Step 6: Pour teriyaki sauce over chicken.
Step 7: Let sauce bubble and thicken for 2-3 minutes, coating chicken well.
Step 8: While chicken cooks, prepare steamed rice according to package directions.
Step 9: Steam broccoli florets for 4-5 minutes until tender-crisp.
Step 10: Divide rice into serving bowls.
Step 11: Top with teriyaki chicken and steamed broccoli.
Step 12: Drizzle with extra sauce from the pan.
Step 13: Garnish with sesame seeds and sliced green onions.

Step 1: Slice 1 lb fresh mozzarella into 1/4-inch thick rounds.
Step 2: Slice 3-4 large ripe tomatoes into similar thickness.
Step 3: Wash and dry fresh basil leaves.
Step 4: Arrange tomato and mozzarella slices on a serving platter, alternating and overlapping.
Step 5: Tuck fresh basil leaves between slices.
Step 6: Drizzle generously with high-quality extra virgin olive oil.
Step 7: Season with flaky sea salt and freshly cracked black pepper.
Step 8: Drizzle with aged balsamic vinegar.
Step 9: Let sit at room temperature for 10 minutes before serving.
Step 10: Serve with crusty bread.

Step 1: Rinse 1.5 cups green or brown lentils and pick out any debris.
Step 2: Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Step 3: Add 1 diced onion, 2 diced carrots, and 2 diced celery stalks.
Step 4: Sauté vegetables for 5-6 minutes until softened.
Step 5: Add 4 minced garlic cloves and cook for 1 minute.
Step 6: Stir in 1 teaspoon cumin, 1/2 teaspoon paprika, and a pinch of cinnamon.
Step 7: Add lentils and stir to coat with spices.
Step 8: Pour in 6 cups vegetable broth.
Step 9: Add 1 can diced tomatoes.
Step 10: Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 30-35 minutes until lentils are tender.
Step 11: Add chopped kale or spinach in the last 5 minutes of cooking.
Step 12: Season with salt, pepper, and a squeeze of lemon juice.
Step 13: Serve hot with crusty bread.

Step 1: Cook 1 lb pasta according to package directions.
Step 2: While pasta cooks, make pesto: combine 2 cups fresh basil leaves, 1/2 cup Parmesan, 1/3 cup pine nuts, 3 garlic cloves, and 1/2 cup olive oil in a food processor.
Step 3: Pulse until smooth, scraping down sides as needed.
Step 4: Season pesto with salt and pepper.
Step 5: If pesto is too thick, add more olive oil or a splash of pasta water.
Step 6: Reserve 1 cup pasta water before draining.
Step 7: Drain pasta and return to pot.
Step 8: Add pesto to pasta and toss well.
Step 9: Add pasta water as needed to create a silky sauce that coats the pasta.
Step 10: Taste and adjust seasoning.
Step 11: Serve immediately topped with extra Parmesan, pine nuts, and fresh basil.
Step 12: Drizzle with a little olive oil.

Step 1: Cook 2 chicken breasts and dice into bite-sized pieces.
Step 2: In a bowl, toss chicken with 1/3 cup buffalo sauce.
Step 3: Warm large tortillas in a skillet.
Step 4: Spread ranch or blue cheese dressing down the center of each tortilla.
Step 5: Add buffalo chicken.
Step 6: Top with shredded lettuce, diced tomatoes, and diced celery.
Step 7: Add shredded cheddar cheese.
Step 8: Fold in sides and roll up tightly.
Step 9: Optional: grill wraps seam-side down for 1-2 minutes.
Step 10: Cut in half diagonally and serve with extra sauce for dipping.

Step 1: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).
Step 2: Choose seasonal vegetables: bell peppers, zucchini, eggplant, carrots, cauliflower, broccoli.
Step 3: Cut all vegetables into similar-sized pieces for even cooking.
Step 4: Place vegetables in a large bowl.
Step 5: Drizzle with 3-4 tablespoons olive oil and toss to coat.
Step 6: Season with salt, pepper, garlic powder, and dried herbs (thyme, rosemary, or Italian seasoning).
Step 7: Spread vegetables in a single layer on a large baking sheet.
Step 8: Don't overcrowd or they'll steam instead of roast.
Step 9: Roast for 25-30 minutes, stirring halfway through.
Step 10: Vegetables should be tender and caramelized at the edges.
Step 11: Remove from oven and drizzle with balsamic vinegar if desired.
Step 12: Garnish with fresh herbs and serve hot.

Step 1: Cut 1 lb sushi-grade tuna into 1/2-inch cubes.
Step 2: In a bowl, make marinade: combine 3 tablespoons soy sauce, 1 tablespoon sesame oil, 1 teaspoon rice vinegar, and 1 teaspoon honey.
Step 3: Add diced tuna to marinade and gently toss.
Step 4: Let marinate in refrigerator for 15-30 minutes.
Step 5: Cook 2 cups sushi rice according to package directions.
Step 6: Season rice with rice vinegar, salt, and sugar.
Step 7: Let rice cool slightly.
Step 8: Dice avocado, cucumber, and edamame.
Step 9: Divide rice into serving bowls.
Step 10: Arrange marinated tuna on one side of each bowl.
Step 11: Add diced vegetables around the bowl.
Step 12: Top with seaweed salad if desired.
Step 13: Drizzle with spicy mayo and sprinkle with sesame seeds.
Step 14: Garnish with sliced green onions and serve with soy sauce.

Step 1: Slice 1.5 lbs chicken breast into thin strips.
Step 2: In a bowl, toss chicken with 2 tablespoons lime juice, 1 teaspoon cumin, 1 teaspoon chili powder, and salt.
Step 3: Let marinate for 15-30 minutes.
Step 4: Slice bell peppers and onions into strips.
Step 5: Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a large cast-iron skillet over high heat.
Step 6: Add chicken in a single layer and cook for 3-4 minutes per side.
Step 7: Remove chicken and set aside.
Step 8: In the same skillet, add peppers and onions.
Step 9: Sauté for 5-6 minutes until softened and slightly charred.
Step 10: Return chicken to skillet and toss with vegetables.
Step 11: Squeeze fresh lime juice over everything.
Step 12: Warm flour tortillas in a dry skillet.
Step 13: Serve chicken and peppers with warm tortillas.
Step 14: Provide toppings: sour cream, guacamole, salsa, cheese, and cilantro.

Step 1: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Step 2: Cut vegetables (carrots, Brussels sprouts, cauliflower, red onion) into bite-sized pieces.
Step 3: Toss vegetables with 3 tablespoons olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Step 4: Spread in a single layer on a baking sheet.
Step 5: Roast for 25-30 minutes until tender and caramelized.
Step 6: While vegetables roast, make balsamic glaze: simmer 1/2 cup balsamic vinegar in a small pot over medium heat.
Step 7: Cook for 8-10 minutes until reduced by half and syrupy.
Step 8: Remove vegetables from oven.
Step 9: Drizzle with balsamic glaze.
Step 10: Toss gently to coat.
Step 11: Garnish with fresh thyme or parsley.
Step 12: Serve hot as a side dish.

Step 1: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Step 2: Pat 4 salmon fillets dry with paper towels.
Step 3: Season with salt and pepper.
Step 4: In a food processor, pulse 1 cup almonds until finely chopped (not powder).
Step 5: Mix chopped almonds with 2 tablespoons melted butter, 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard, and 1 tablespoon honey.
Step 6: Add lemon zest and fresh thyme to almond mixture.
Step 7: Press almond mixture onto top of each salmon fillet, creating a crust.
Step 8: Place salmon on a baking sheet lined with parchment.
Step 9: Bake for 15-18 minutes until salmon is cooked through and crust is golden.
Step 10: Remove from oven and let rest for 3 minutes.
Step 11: Serve with lemon wedges and roasted vegetables.

Step 1: Dice 1 onion, 2 bell peppers, and 2 carrots.
Step 2: Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Step 3: Add diced onion and cook for 5 minutes.
Step 4: Add bell peppers and carrots, cook for 5 more minutes.
Step 5: Add 4 minced garlic cloves, 2 tablespoons chili powder, 1 tablespoon cumin, and 1 teaspoon paprika.
Step 6: Cook spices for 1 minute until fragrant.
Step 7: Add 2 cans diced tomatoes, 2 cans black beans (drained), 1 can kidney beans (drained), and 1 can corn.
Step 8: Pour in 2 cups vegetable broth.
Step 9: Stir in 1 tablespoon cocoa powder for depth.
Step 10: Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes.
Step 11: Season with salt and pepper.
Step 12: Stir in fresh cilantro.
Step 13: Serve with toppings: sour cream, cheese, avocado, and cornbread.

Step 1: Press 14 oz extra-firm tofu between paper towels for 15 minutes to remove excess moisture.
Step 2: Cut tofu into 1-inch cubes.
Step 3: Toss tofu with 1 tablespoon cornstarch to help it crisp.
Step 4: Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Step 5: Add tofu in a single layer and cook for 3-4 minutes per side until golden and crispy.
Step 6: While tofu cooks, make sauce: whisk together 3 tablespoons soy sauce, 2 tablespoons rice vinegar, 1 tablespoon honey, 1 tablespoon sesame oil, 1 tablespoon grated ginger, and 2 minced garlic cloves.
Step 7: Once tofu is crispy, pour sauce over it.
Step 8: Toss gently and cook for 2 minutes until sauce thickens.
Step 9: Remove from heat.
Step 10: Garnish with sesame seeds and sliced green onions.
Step 11: Serve over rice with steamed broccoli.

Step 1: Cut 1.5 lbs chicken breast into 1-inch cubes.
Step 2: Make marinade: combine 1/4 cup olive oil, juice of 2 lemons, 4 minced garlic cloves, 1 tablespoon oregano, 1 teaspoon paprika, salt, and pepper.
Step 3: Add chicken to marinade and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
Step 4: Soak wooden skewers in water for 30 minutes.
Step 5: Thread marinated chicken onto skewers.
Step 6: Preheat grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
Step 7: Grill skewers for 10-12 minutes, turning every 3 minutes, until chicken is cooked through.
Step 8: While chicken grills, make tzatziki: mix 1 cup Greek yogurt, 1/2 diced cucumber (squeezed dry), 2 minced garlic cloves, 1 tablespoon lemon juice, and fresh dill.
Step 9: Season tzatziki with salt and pepper.
Step 10: Remove skewers from grill and let rest for 5 minutes.
Step 11: Serve with tzatziki sauce, warm pita bread, and Greek salad.

Step 1: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Step 2: Cut 1 large butternut squash in half lengthwise and scoop out seeds.
Step 3: Brush cut sides with olive oil and place face-down on a baking sheet.
Step 4: Roast for 45-50 minutes until very tender.
Step 5: Let cool slightly, then scoop flesh into a pot.
Step 6: Add 1 diced onion that's been sautéed until soft.
Step 7: Add 3-4 cups vegetable broth.
Step 8: Season with salt, pepper, nutmeg, and a pinch of cinnamon.
Step 9: Bring to a simmer and cook for 10 minutes.
Step 10: Use an immersion blender to puree until completely smooth.
Step 11: Stir in 1/4 cup heavy cream for richness.
Step 12: Taste and adjust seasoning.
Step 13: Serve hot garnished with roasted pumpkin seeds, a drizzle of cream, and fresh sage.

Step 1: In a jar or bowl, combine 1/4 cup chia seeds with 1 cup milk (dairy or non-dairy).
Step 2: Add 1 tablespoon maple syrup or honey.
Step 3: Add 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract.
Step 4: Stir well to combine and prevent clumping.
Step 5: Cover and refrigerate overnight (or at least 4 hours).
Step 6: In the morning, stir pudding again.
Step 7: If too thick, add a splash more milk.
Step 8: Divide into serving bowls or jars.
Step 9: Top with fresh berries (strawberries, blueberries, raspberries).
Step 10: Add sliced banana if desired.
Step 11: Sprinkle with granola, nuts, or coconut flakes.
Step 12: Drizzle with additional honey if desired.
Step 13: Serve chilled.

Step 1: Season 2 lbs chicken breasts with salt and pepper.
Step 2: Place chicken in slow cooker.
Step 3: In a bowl, mix 1 cup BBQ sauce, 1/4 cup apple cider vinegar, 2 tablespoons brown sugar, 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce, and 1 teaspoon smoked paprika.
Step 4: Pour sauce over chicken.
Step 5: Add 1 sliced onion on top.
Step 6: Cover and cook on low for 6-7 hours or high for 3-4 hours.
Step 7: Chicken should be very tender and easily shredded.
Step 8: Remove chicken from slow cooker and shred with two forks.
Step 9: Return shredded chicken to slow cooker and toss with sauce.
Step 10: Let sit for 10 minutes to absorb sauce.
Step 11: Serve on toasted buns with coleslaw.
Step 12: Provide extra BBQ sauce on the side.
